SEARCH
Package librarySE.repo

Class FileWaitlistRepository

java.lang.Object
librarySE.repo.FileWaitlistRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
WaitlistRepository
public class FileWaitlistRepository extends Object implements WaitlistRepository
File-based implementation of WaitlistRepository that persists WaitlistEntry objects in JSON format.

This repository stores the waitlist of users waiting for specific library items. Data is saved in a file named waitlist.json under the application's data directory.

Storage Details:

  • File Path: library_data/waitlist.json
  • Format: JSON (serialized using Gson)
  • Utility: FileUtils handles reading/writing safely

Usage Example:


 WaitlistRepository repo = new FileWaitlistRepository();

 // Load current waitlist
 List<WaitlistEntry> waitlist = repo.loadAll();

 // Add a new entry
 waitlist.add(new WaitlistEntry("BOOK-123", "student@najah.edu", LocalDate.now()));

 // Save updates
 repo.saveAll(waitlist);
Author:
Eman

  • Method Details

    • loadAll

      public List<WaitlistEntry> loadAll()
      Loads all WaitlistEntry objects from persistent storage.

      If the file does not exist or is empty, returns an empty list instead of null.

      Specified by:
      loadAll in interface WaitlistRepository
      Returns:
      list of waitlist entries; never null, but may be empty

    • saveAll

      public void saveAll(List<WaitlistEntry> entries)
      Saves the provided list of WaitlistEntry objects to persistent storage.

      Overwrites existing data with the new list.

      Specified by:
      saveAll in interface WaitlistRepository
      Parameters:
      entries - the list of waitlist entries to save; must not be null
